$IONQ The fact that they‚Äôll be selling whole new systems in addition to compute time on the cloud tells me that the pace of new generations of system release will start to accelerate. It would seem to me the best ROI for each generation of systems would be to sell in bulk rather than spread revenue over a time frame that would get shorter and shorter. Time will tell but that‚Äôs my day impression of the sudden change in their sales strategy. Another thing I‚Äôm almost certain of is that Aria is not by any stretch their most advanced system. They‚Äôre probably finishing up the multi-core barium systems
created_at: and it wouldn‚Äôt be a stretch that every 6-12 months they would integrate a new core and start shipping out new generations of multi-core systems. My hope is that they have thought out the pros and cons of shipping away their entire systems as it exposes it to potential replication of the manufacturing processes by other companies or entities.
